title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement explore.statistics@education.gov.uk. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to dfeshiny
text: Try make use usethis package wherever possible. initially clone package, first thing ’ll need install devtools: load package current form:
code: install.packages("devtools") devtools::load_all()

title: Contributing to dfeshiny
text: usethis::use_package(<package_name>) Note adding function another package one dfeshiny functions need explicitly state package function call, e.g.: package::function() Alternatively, ’s lot uses single function within one R scripts, can call function top R script, e.g: information see roxygen2 documentation declaring dependencies.
code: @' importFrom package function

title: Contributing to dfeshiny
text: usethis::use_r(name = <script_name>) create new blank script within package R/ folder.

what: Creating a new function test script
title: Contributing to dfeshiny
text: usethis::use_test(name = <script_name>) create new blank test script within package testthat/ folder. want test function live dashboard using shinytest2, test_dashboard can found tests/ folder can add examples tests. can run dashboard using: can run tests dashboard using:
code: shiny::runApp("tests/test_dashboard") shinytest2::test_app("tests/test_dashboard")

title: Contributing to dfeshiny
text: run following lines test package locally: get lot lintr errors, particularly around things defined, make sure load package first using Ctrl-Shft-L devtools::load_all("."), run . ’s known issue lintr picking bindings packages loaded.
code: # To check functionality devtools::check() # Ctrl-Shft-E shinytest2::test_app("tests/test_dashboard")  # For code styling styler::style_pkg() lintr::lint_package()  # To check for typos spelling::spell_check_package()  # and if needed spelling::update_wordlist()

title: Contributing to dfeshiny
text: changes completed, reviewed ready use wild, can increment package version using: usethis::use_version() ’ve incremented version number, ’ll add new heading news.md. Add summary news.md accept ’s offer commit behalf. pushed main branch, create new release GitHub .

what: Why are these changes being made?
title: Brief overview of changes
Using the dfeshiny Deploy Template
text: deploy_parameters.yaml: Store deployment parameters, including app name deployment target. Minimal Local Workflow: Reference remote reusable workflow (stored another repository) local .github/workflows/deploy.yaml. Secrets Management: Ensure repository required secrets (e.g., SHINYAPPS_TOKEN SHINYAPPS_SECRET) set Settings > Secrets variables.

title: Using the dfeshiny Deploy Template
text: root project, add file called deploy_parameters.yaml. example optional parameters: dashboard_name: application’s name ShinyApps (hosting platform). deploy_target: want deploy (e.g., "shinyapps").
code: dashboard_name: "my-cool-dashboard" deploy_target: "shinyapps"

title: Using the dfeshiny Deploy Template
text: local .github/workflows/ folder, create edit file—commonly named deploy.yaml. file defines trigger conditions (branches watch) calls remote reusable workflow. minimal example: : push… ensures workflow runs whenever code pushed main development. uses: dfe-analytical-services/dfeshiny-deploy-templates… points remote repo file containing actual deployment steps. : parameter_file: deploy_parameters.yaml tells remote workflow file parse parameters.
code: name: Deploy Dashboard  on:   push:     branches:       - main       - development  jobs:   deploy:     uses: dfe-analytical-services/dfeshiny/.github/workflows/deploy-dashboard-template.yaml@main     with:       parameter_file: deploy_parameters.yaml

title: Using the dfeshiny Deploy Template
text: deployment can succeed, need set relevant secrets local repository. secrets shared automatically across repos, must create project’s Settings > Secrets variables > Actions: SHINYAPPS_TOKEN SHINYAPPS_SECRET

title: Using the dfeshiny Deploy Template
text: commit deploy.yaml deploy_parameters.yaml, GitHub Actions runner : Check Code – Pulls repository code deploy_parameters.yaml. Parse Parameters – Uses tool like yq read deploy_parameters.yaml: dashboard_name deploy_target Restore R Dependencies – project uses renv, runs renv::restore() ensure local library consistent. Deploy – Calls appropriate deployment method based deploy_target. ShinyApps.io, uses rsconnect::deployApp().

title: Using the dfeshiny Deploy Template
text: Using reusable GitHub Actions workflow template: Reduces complexity dashboards deployments - maintain minimal local config . Ensures consistent deployment practices across dashboards. Makes easy update deployments across dashboards minimal changes repository. questions credentials advanced usage, contact Explore Education Statistics Platforms team explore.statistics@education.gov.uk. Whilst following instructions article help set deployment dashboard, still need seek approval publish Explore Education Statistics team ask set secrets management GitHub deployment go . steps, can quickly set dashboards deploy push—whether ’s ShinyApps.io future DfE platform—keeping deployment logic single, centralized workflow template.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Rich Bielby. Author, maintainer. Charlotte Foster. Author. Cam Race. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Bielby R, Foster C, Race C (2025). dfeshiny: DfE R Shiny Standards. R package version 0.5.3.9000https://dfe-analytical-services.github.io/dfeshiny/ https://www.github.com/dfe-analytical-services/dfeshiny/, https://dfe-analytical-services.github.io/dfeshiny/    https://www.github.com/dfe-analytical-services/dfeshiny/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {dfeshiny: DfE R Shiny Standards},   author = {Rich Bielby and Charlotte Foster and Cam Race},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.5.3.9000https://dfe-analytical-services.github.io/dfeshiny/     https://www.github.com/dfe-analytical-services/dfeshiny/},   url = {https://dfe-analytical-services.github.io/dfeshiny/     https://www.github.com/dfe-analytical-services/dfeshiny/}, }

title: DfE R Shiny Standards
text: R package support analysts developing official DfE dashboards help meet necessary standards required public facing government services.

title: DfE R Shiny Standards
text: dfeshiny currently available CRAN. time can install development version GitHub. using renv project (recommended): Otherwise: update version ’re using renv, simply: snapshot update lockfile
code: renv::install("dfe-analytical-services/dfeshiny") # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("dfe-analytical-services/dfeshiny") renv::update("dfe-analytical-services/dfeshiny") renv::snapshot()

what: Installing functionality in development from a branch
title: DfE R Shiny Standards
text: can useful developing package particular trial new updated functionality shiny app. , can install required branch using (replacing branch-name name branch wish install): renv::install("dfe-analytical-services/dfeshiny@branch-name") install code named branch dfeshiny app. need restart R session start using latest version ’ve installed.

title: DfE R Shiny Standards
text: get ERROR [curl: (22) requested URL returned error: 401], don’t know , try running Sys.unsetenv("GITHUB_PAT") temporarily clear GitHub PAT variable. try install . works, need look “GITHUB_PAT” variable set remove permanently fix issue, contact us support need help issues installing.

previous_headings: Using this package in a DfE data dashboard
title: DfE R Shiny Standards
text: analytics function dashboard, need : request Google Analytics key explore education statisics platforms team create HTML file javascript required dashboard connect Google Analytics add line: tags$head(includeHTML(("google-analytics.html"))), ui.R file. create latter, provide function dfeshiny::init_analytics(). run code R console providing Google Analytics code follows (replacing ABCDE12345 code obtained explore education statistics platforms team): create file google-analytics.html within home directory R project. html file can edited add customised analytics recorders different shiny elements dashboard. Feel free contact team need support adding additional functionality.
code: init_analytics("ABCDE12345")

previous_headings: Using this package in a DfE data dashboard
what: Adding a custom disconnect message to your dashboard
title: DfE R Shiny Standards
text: dfeshiny provides function add custom disconnect message dashboard - appear dashboard otherwise ‘grey-screen’ include options refresh page, go overflow sites visit publication directly Explore education statistics. following parameters defined --date global.R script: sites_list ees_pub_name ees_publication include custom disconnect message, insert following line ui.R script: Putting lines just shinyGovstyle::header(...) line work well.
code: custom_disconnect_message(    links = sites_list,    publication_name = ees_pub_name,    publication_link = ees_publication  ),

title: DfE R Shiny Standards
text: Ideas dfeshiny first raised GitHub issue anyone free write code create pull request review. details contributing dfeshiny, see contributing guidelines.

title: Accessibility panel — a11y_panel
text: Create accessibility statement dashboard. always completed live public dashboards conjunction Explore education statistics platforms team Note model statement created based GDS model accessibility statement

title: Accessibility panel — a11y_panel
code: a11y_panel(   dashboard_title,   dashboard_url,   date_tested,   date_prepared,   date_reviewed,   date_template_reviewed = "12 March 2024",   issues_contact = NULL,   publication_name = NULL,   publication_slug = NULL,   non_accessible_components =     c("Keyboard navigation through the interactive charts is currently limited",     "Alternative text in interactive charts is limited to titles"),   specific_issues =     c("Charts have non-accessible components that are inaccessible for keyboard users.",     "Chart tooltips are not compatible with screen reader use.",     "Some decorative images are not labelled appropriately as yet.",     "Some links are not appropriately labelled.") )

title: Accessibility panel — a11y_panel
text: dashboard_title Title host dashboard dashboard_url URL host dashboard date_tested Date application last tested date_prepared Date statement prepared current form date_reviewed Date statement last reviewed date_template_reviewed Date underlying template reviewed (default: 12th March 2024) issues_contact URL GitHub Issues log contact e-mail address users flag accessibility issues publication_name parent publication name (optional) publication_slug parent publication slug Explore Education Statistics (optional) non_accessible_components String vector containing list non accessible components specific_issues String vector containing descriptions specific accessibility issues identified part testing

title: Accessibility panel — a11y_panel
text: shiny$tags$div element containing HTML tags content standard accessibility statement

title: Accessibility panel — a11y_panel
code:
a11y_panel( "DfE Shiny template", "https://department-for-education.shinyapps.io/dfe-shiny-template", "25th April 2024", "26th April 2024", "2nd November 2024", issues_contact = "https://github.com/dfe-analytical-services/shiny-template", publication_slug = "la-and-school-expenditure", publication_name = "LA and school expenditure" ) #>
#>

Accessibility statement for DfE Shiny template

#>

#> This accessibility statement applies to the #> https://department-for-education.shinyapps.io/dfe-shiny-template #> website. This website is run by the Department for Education (DfE) (opens in new tab). #> This statement does not cover any other services run by the Department for Education #> (DfE) or GOV.UK. #>

#>

How you should be able to use this website

#>

We want as many people as possible to be able to use this website. You should be able to:

#>
#>
    #>
  • change colours, contrast levels and fonts using browser or device settings
    • #>
  • zoom in up to 400% without the text spilling off the screen
    • #>
  • navigate most of the website using a keyboard or speech recognition software
    • #>
  • listen to most of the website using a screen reader #> (including the most recent versions of JAWS, NVDA and VoiceOver)
    • #>
#>
#>

We've also made the website text as simple as possible to understand.

#>

AbilityNet (opens in new tab) has advice on making your device easier to use if you have a disability. #>

#>

How accessible this website is

#>

We know some parts of this website are not fully accessible:

#>
#>
    #>
  1. Keyboard navigation through the interactive charts is currently limited
    2. #>
  2. Alternative text in interactive charts is limited to titles
    3. #>
#>
#>

Feedback and contact information

#>

#> If you need information on this website in a different format please see the #> parent publication, LA and school expenditure (opens in new tab). #>

#>

#> More details are available on that service for alternative formats of this #> data. #>

#>

We're always looking to improve the accessibility of this website. #> If you find any problems not listed on this page or think we're not meeting #> accessibility requirements, contact us:

#>
    #>
  • #> explore.statistics@education.gov.uk #>
    • #>
#>

Enforcement procedure

#>

#> The Equality and Human Rights Commission (EHRC) is responsible for enforcing the Public #> Sector Bodies (Websites and Mobile Applications) (No. 2) Accessibility Regulations 2018 #> (the "accessibility regulations"). #>

#>

#> If you are not happy with how we respond to your complaint, contact the Equality Advisory and Support Service (EASS) (opens in new tab). #>

#>

Technical information about this website's accessibility

#>

#> The Department for Education (DfE) is committed to making its website accessible, in #> accordance with the Public Sector Bodies (Websites and Mobile Applications) (No. 2) #> Accessibility Regulations 2018. #>

#>

Compliance status

#>

#> This website is partially compliant with the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines version 2.2 AA standard (opens in new tab) due to the non-compliances listed below. #>

#>

Non accessible content

#>

The content listed below is non-accessible for the following reasons. #> We will address these issues to ensure our content is accessible.

#>
#>
    #>
  1. Charts have non-accessible components that are inaccessible for keyboard users.
    2. #>
  2. Chart tooltips are not compatible with screen reader use.
    3. #>
  3. Some decorative images are not labelled appropriately as yet.
    4. #>
  4. Some links are not appropriately labelled.
    5. #>
#>
#>

Disproportionate burden

#>

Not applicable.

#>

How we tested this website

#>

#> The template used for this website was last tested on #> 12 March 2024 #> against Accessibility Guidelines WCAG2.2 (opens in new tab). The test was carried out by the Digital accessibility centre (DAC) (opens in new tab). #>

#>

DAC tested a sample of pages to cover the core functionality of the service including:

#>
#>
    #>
  • navigation
    • #>
  • interactive dropdown selections
    • #>
  • charts, maps, and tables
    • #>
#>
#>

#> This specific website was was last tested on #> 25 April 2024 #> against Accessibility Guidelines WCAG2.2 (opens in new tab). The test was carried out by the Department for Education (DfE) (opens in new tab). #>

#>

What we're doing to improve accessibility

#>

#> We plan to continually test the service for accessibility issues, and are working #> through a prioritised list of issues to resolve. #>

#>

#> Our current list of issues to be resolved is available on our GitHub issues page (opens in new tab). #>

#>

Preparation of this accessibility statement

#>

#> This statement was prepared on 26 April 2024 and last reviewed on 02 November 2024. #> The statement was produced based on a combination of testing carried out by the Digital accessibility centre (DAC) (opens in new tab) and our own testing. #>

#>

title: dfe_cookies_script — cookies
text: Calls JavaScript dependencies shiny app used set unset cookies. Function placed ui.R script.

title: dfe_cookies_script — cookies
code: dfe_cookies_script()

title: dfe_cookies_script — cookies
text: shiny::tags$head()

title: dfe_cookies_script — cookies
code: if (interactive()) {   # This example shows how to use the full family of cookies functions together   # This will be in your global.R script ===================================    library(shiny)   library(shinyjs)   library(dfeshiny)   google_analytics_key <- "ABCDE12345"    # This will be what is in your ui.R script ===============================    ui <- fluidPage(     # Place these lines above your header ----------------------------------     useShinyjs(),     dfe_cookies_script(),     cookies_banner_ui(name = "My DfE R-Shiny data dashboard"),      # Place the cookies panel under the header but in the main content -----     # Example of placing as a panel within navlistPanel     shiny::navlistPanel(       "",       id = "navlistPanel",       widths = c(2, 8),       well = FALSE,       ## Cookies panel -----------------------------------------------------       shiny::tabPanel(         value = "cookies_panel_ui",         "Cookies",         cookies_panel_ui(google_analytics_key = google_analytics_key)       )     )   )    # This will be in your server.R file =====================================    server <- function(input, output, session) {     # Server logic for the pop up banner, can be placed anywhere in server.R -     output$cookies_status <- dfeshiny::cookies_banner_server(       input_cookies = reactive(input$cookies),       google_analytics_key = google_analytics_key,       parent_session = session     )      # Server logic for the panel, can be placed anywhere in server.R -------     cookies_panel_server(       input_cookies = reactive(input$cookies),       google_analytics_key = google_analytics_key     )   }    # How to run the minimal app given in this example =======================   shinyApp(ui, server) }

title: cookies_banner_server — cookies_banner_server
text: cookies_banner_server() provides server module used alongside cookies_banner_ui(). Place cookies_banner_server() call server.R file provide server functions control users able accept reject cookie consent provision Google Analytics tracking DfE R-Shiny dashboards.

title: cookies_banner_server — cookies_banner_server
code: cookies_banner_server(   id = "cookies_banner",   input_cookies,   parent_session,   google_analytics_key = NULL,   cookies_link_panel = "cookies_panel_ui",   cookies_nav_id = "navlistPanel" )

title: cookies_banner_server — cookies_banner_server
text: id Shiny tag shared cookies_banner_ui(), can string set user long matches id cookies_banner_ui() input_cookies cookie input passed cookies.js (always reactive(input$cookies)) parent_session R Shiny app session, expect always parent_session = session google_analytics_key Provide GA 10 digit key form "ABCDE12345" cookies_link_panel name navigation panel cookie banner provides link , usually "cookies_panel_ui" cookies_nav_id ID navigation panel cookie panel page within, defaults "navlistPanel"

title: cookies_banner_server — cookies_banner_server
code: if (interactive()) {   # This example shows how to use the full family of cookies functions together   # This will be in your global.R script ===================================    library(shiny)   library(shinyjs)   library(dfeshiny)   google_analytics_key <- "ABCDE12345"    # This will be what is in your ui.R script ===============================    ui <- fluidPage(     # Place these lines above your header ----------------------------------     useShinyjs(),     dfe_cookies_script(),     cookies_banner_ui(name = "My DfE R-Shiny data dashboard"),      # Place the cookies panel under the header but in the main content -----     # Example of placing as a panel within navlistPanel     shiny::navlistPanel(       "",       id = "navlistPanel",       widths = c(2, 8),       well = FALSE,       ## Cookies panel -----------------------------------------------------       shiny::tabPanel(         value = "cookies_panel_ui",         "Cookies",         cookies_panel_ui(google_analytics_key = google_analytics_key)       )     )   )    # This will be in your server.R file =====================================    server <- function(input, output, session) {     # Server logic for the pop up banner, can be placed anywhere in server.R -     output$cookies_status <- dfeshiny::cookies_banner_server(       input_cookies = reactive(input$cookies),       google_analytics_key = google_analytics_key,       parent_session = session     )      # Server logic for the panel, can be placed anywhere in server.R -------     cookies_panel_server(       input_cookies = reactive(input$cookies),       google_analytics_key = google_analytics_key     )   }    # How to run the minimal app given in this example =======================   shinyApp(ui, server) }

title: Custom disconnect message — custom_disconnect_message
text: refresh text appear refresh page clicked dashboard_title Title dashboard links vector possible URLs public site. mostly just single URL, can two URLs overflow site set publication_name parent publication name publication_link link publication Explore Education Statistics support_contact Email address support contact, defaults explore.statistics@education.gov.uk custom_refresh Custom refresh link, defaults refreshing page, main value bookmarking enabled want refresh send initial view instead reloading bookmarks

title: Custom disconnect message — custom_disconnect_message
text: HTML overlay panel appears user loses connection DfE R Shiny dashboard.

title: Custom disconnect message — custom_disconnect_message
code:
custom_disconnect_message( dashboard_title = "DfE Shiny Template", refresh = "Refresh page", links = c( "https://department-for-education.shinyapps.io/dfe-shiny-template", "https://department-for-education.shinyapps.io/dfe-shiny-template-overflow/" ), publication_name = "Explore Education Statistics Publication", publication_link = "https://explore-education-statistics.service.gov.uk/find-statistics/apprenticeships" ) #> #>
#>
#>

#> Sorry, you have lost connection to the #> DfE Shiny Template #> dashboard at the moment, please #> Refresh page. #>

#>

#> If you are still experiencing issues, please try our #> alternative site. Apologies for the inconvenience. #>

#>

#> The data used in this dashboard can also be viewed or downloaded via the Explore Education Statistics Publication (opens in new tab) on explore education statistics. #>

#>

#> Feel free to contact explore.statistics@education.gov.uk (opens in new tab) if you require further support. #>

#>
#>
#>
custom_disconnect_message( dashboard_title = "DfE Shiny Template", refresh = "Refresh page", links = c( "https://department-for-education.shinyapps.io/dfe-shiny-template" ) ) #> #>
#>
#>

#> Sorry, you have lost connection to the #> DfE Shiny Template #> dashboard at the moment, please #> Refresh page. #>

#>

#> Feel free to contact explore.statistics@education.gov.uk (opens in new tab) if you require further support. #>

#>
#>
#>
custom_disconnect_message( support_contact = "my.team@education.gov.uk", custom_refresh = "https://department-for-education.shinyapps.io/my-dashboard" ) #> #>
#>
#>

#> Sorry, you have lost connection to the #> dashboard at the moment, please #> Refresh page. #>

#>

#> Feel free to contact my.team@education.gov.uk (opens in new tab) if you require further support. #>

#>
#>
#>

what: Department for Education Reactable Wrapper — dfe_reactable
title: Department for Education Reactable Wrapper — dfe_reactable
text: wrapper around reactable function creating styled, accessible, user-friendly tables tailored Department Education's requirements.

title: Department for Education Reactable Wrapper — dfe_reactable
code: dfe_reactable(data, ...)

title: Department for Education Reactable Wrapper — dfe_reactable
text: data data frame display table. ... Additional arguments passed reactable::reactable.

title: Department for Education Reactable Wrapper — dfe_reactable
text: reactable HTML widget object.

title: Department for Education Reactable Wrapper — dfe_reactable
text: dfe_reactable function provides pre-configured version reactable function : Highlighting: Row highlighting enabled. Borderless Table: Removes borders clean look. Sort Icons Hidden: Sort icons displayed default. Resizable Columns: Users can resize columns. Full Width: Table expands full width container. Default Column Definition: Custom column header styles, NA value handling, alignment. Custom Search Input: search bar styled Department Education's specifications. Custom Language: Provides user-friendly search placeholder text.

title: Department for Education Reactable Wrapper — dfe_reactable
code: if (interactive()) {   library(shiny)   library(dfeshiny)   ui <- fluidPage(     h1("Example of dfe_reactable in a Shiny app"),     dfe_reactable(mtcars)   )   server <- function(input, output, session) {}   shinyApp(ui, server) }

title: External link — external_link
text: commonplace external links open new tab, careful... function automatically adds following link: target="_blank" open new tab rel="noopener noreferrer" prevent reverse tabnabbing default function also adds "(opens new tab)" link text warn users behaviour. also adds "link opens new tab" visually hidden span element within HTML outputted warn non-visual users behaviour. function error end full stop, give warning particularly short link text automatically trim leading trailing white space inputted link_text. displaying lots links together want save space avoiding repeating (opens new tab), can set add_warning = FALSE add line text links saying something like 'following links open new tab'. Related links guidance: Government digital services guidelines use links Anchor tag HTML element properties WCAG 2.2 success criteria 2.4.4: Link Purpose (Context) Web Accessibility standards link text behaviour

title: External link — external_link
code: external_link(href, link_text, add_warning = TRUE)

title: External link — external_link
text: href URL want link point link_text Text appear describing link, must descriptive page linking . Vague text like 'click ' '' cause error, ending full stop. Leading trailing white space automatically trimmed. string shorter 7 characters console warning thrown. way hush providing detail. add_warning Boolean adding "(opens new tab)" end link text warn users behaviour. careful consider accessibility removing visual warning.

title: External link — external_link
text: shiny.tag object

title: External link — external_link
text: Intentionally basic wrapper HTML anchor elements making easier create safe external links standard accessible behaviour. information tag generated, see tags.

title: External link — external_link
code:
external_link("https://shiny.posit.co/", "R Shiny") #> R Shiny (opens in new tab) external_link( "https://shiny.posit.co/", "R Shiny", add_warning = FALSE ) #> R Shiny (opens in new tab) # This will trim and show as 'R Shiny' external_link("https://shiny.posit.co/", " R Shiny") #> R Shiny (opens in new tab) # Example of within text shiny::tags$p( "Oi, ", external_link("https://shiny.posit.co/", "R Shiny"), " is great." ) #>

#> Oi, R Shiny (opens in new tab) is great. #>

# Example of multiple links together shiny::tags$h2("Related resources") #>

Related resources

shiny::tags$p("The following links open in a new tab.") #>

The following links open in a new tab.

shiny::tags$ul( shiny::tags$li( external_link( "https://shiny.posit.co/", "R Shiny documentation", add_warning = FALSE ) ), shiny::tags$li( external_link( "https://www.python.org/", "Python documentation", add_warning = FALSE ) ), shiny::tags$li( external_link( "https://nextjs.org/", "Next.js documentation", add_warning = FALSE ) ) ) #>
    #>
  • R Shiny documentation (opens in new tab)
    • #>
  • Python documentation (opens in new tab)
    • #>
  • Next.js documentation (opens in new tab)
    • #>

title: Create shiny::tagList() for HTML section — section_tags
code: section_tags(heading = NULL, body, h_level = "h2")

title: Create shiny::tagList() for HTML section — section_tags
text: heading Optional - single text string shiny::tagList() object heading paragraph body single text string shiny::tagList() object body paragraph h_level Specify level heading, choose include one. Default "h2". Available options "h2","h3" "h4".

title: Create shiny::tagList() for HTML section — section_tags
text: list HTML tags contain paragraph body optional heading.

title: Create shiny::tagList() for HTML section — section_tags
code:
# Example for text heading and body section_tags( heading = "Heading test", body = "This is a body text test" ) #>

Heading test

#>

This is a body text test

# Example for using a different heading level section_tags( heading = "Heading test", body = "This is a body text test", h_level = "h3" ) #>

Heading test

#>

This is a body text test

# Example for text heading and text with other elements in the body section_tags( heading = "Heading test", body = shiny::tagList( "This is a body text test. Please contact us at", dfeshiny::external_link( href = paste0("mailto:", "team@education.gov.uk"), link_text = "team@education.gov.uk", add_warning = FALSE ) ) ) #>

Heading test

#>

#> This is a body text test. Please contact us atteam@education.gov.uk (opens in new tab)

title: Support panel — support_panel
text: team_email team e-mail address, must education.gov.uk email repo_name repository URL, must valid URL dfe-analytical-services GitHub area ees_publication Whether parent publication hosted Explore Education Statistics publication_name parent publication name publication_slug parent publication slug Explore Education Statistics alt_href Alternative link parent publication (hosted Explore Education Statistics) form_url URL feedback form dashboard custom_data_info single text string shiny::tagList() object custom text go "Find information data" heading. extra_text Add extra paragraphs page "Contact us" section. Use dfeshiny::section_tags() specify heading body. Look examples see add one multiple sections.

title: Support panel — support_panel
text: HTML div, containing standard support content public R Shiny dashboard DfE

title: Support panel — support_panel
code:
support_panel( team_email = "my.team@education.gov.uk", repo_name = "https://github.com/dfe-analytical-services/my-repo", publication_name = "My publication title", publication_slug = "my-publication-title", form_url = "www.myform.com" ) #>
#>

Support and feedback

#>

Give us feedback

title: Tidy code — tidy_code
text: Script apply styler code styling scripts within shiny directory structure.

title: Tidy code — tidy_code
code: tidy_code(subdirs = c("R", "tests"))

title: Tidy code — tidy_code
text: subdirs List sub-directories (recursively search R scripts styled)

title: Tidy code — tidy_code
text: TRUE changes made scripts, FALSE passed.

title: Tidy code — tidy_code
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ tidy_code() } # }

title: dfeshiny (development version)
text: Added extra flexibility custom disconnect message contact details refresh link Relaxed arguments cookies banner different IDs can used navigation panel Fixed bug inputId cookies banner

title: dfeshiny 0.5.3
text: Added dfeshiny::a11y_panel() create model accessibility statement custom issue listings.

title: dfeshiny 0.5.2
text: Added dfeshiny::header() function produce standardised header incorporating current DfE logo. wrapper function shinyGovstyle::header(), reducing range options.

title: dfeshiny 0.5.1
text: Refresh disconnect dialogue message styling

title: dfeshiny 0.5.0
text: custom_data_info argument added support_panel() users can write custom text “Find information data” section. extra_text argument added support_panel() users can add sections. Added section_tags() provide structure extra_text argument support_panel(). Added “link” look data bad_link_text

title: dfeshiny 0.4.3
text: Fix bug external_link() hidden warning can read screen readers.

title: dfeshiny 0.4.2
text: Applied use external_link() support_panel().

title: dfeshiny 0.4.1
text: Fix bug external_link() visually hidden text visually hidden whitespace appearing add_warning = FALSE set.

title: dfeshiny 0.4.0
text: Add new external_link() function look data bad_link_text.

title: dfeshiny 0.3.0
text: init_analytics() add necessary analytics script repository. New cookies module panel page added, completing cookies family functions, shared examples vignette walk use .

title: dfeshiny 0.3.0
text: cookie_banner_server() now cookies_banner_server() cookie_banner_ui() now cookie_banner_ui() dfe_cookie_script() now dfe_cookies_script() removed dependency using shiny::tabPanel() within support_panel() now return content rather tabPanel.

title: dfeshiny 0.3.0
text: Automated testing test dashboard using GitHub actions. Fixed favicons pkgdown site. Moved code init_cookies() inline, prevent dependency main GitHub branch. Added separate contributing guidelines make README user focused. Added issues PR templates.

title: dfeshiny 0.2.0
text: dfeshiny now pkgdown site! custom_disconnect_message() function brought dfeshiny help handle disconnects host server signpost restarting given app. module now provided produce standardised cookie consent banner implement associated functionality. server part cookies_banner_server() ui part cookies_banner_ui(). addition, dfe_cookies_script() provided implement necessary javascript.

title: dfeshiny 0.2.0
text: Implemented basic unit testing (currently just e-mail validation) UI testing using test dashboard. Instructions within package README.md install dfeshiny updated.
